Body: I want to control my devices connected to Raspberry pi 3B+ from a webpage. Web page is a real website thus can be accesed from anywhere. How can I do this?

There are a lot of ways to control devices. I use a raspberry to turn on and off a computer, from a web interface. I've connected a relay on the GPIO pins and I rewired the power button from the mainboard of the computer, to run through the relay.

The web interface runs using php. So, just a basic example of a script, running in php that makes the relay do a click looks like this:

shell_exec('/usr/local/bin/gpio -g mode 17 out');	shell_exec('/usr/local/bin/gpio -g write 17 1');	usleep(500000);	shell_exec('/usr/local/bin/gpio -g write 17 0');

The script sets pin 17 for output, then turns on the voltage on the pin, waits half a second then turns off the voltage. The relay is connected to ground and pin 17 on the GPIO, of course.

Keep in mind that this is a very basic example of using GPIO from php, without any libraries.

In my case, the web interface is hosted on the raspberry pi. My router forwards port 443 to the pi, so the web interface is public and accessible from anywhere, since I have a domain pointing to the router.

One simple way to do this is as follows:

1) deploy an MQTT broker on the public cloud or use a free public broker such as iot.eclipse.org if data security isn't a concern
2) Implement a javascript MQTT client on the website that can subscribe to and publish to MQTT topics on the broker
3) Implement another client on the raspberry pi in a language of your choice and link that to your devices

If you want your data to be encrypted, you can also set up transport layer security using OpenSSL certificates
